newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil November industry sales up 1.45 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brazil November industry sales up 1.45 pct.

text.p: Brazilian industry sales rose a seasonally adjusted 1.45 percent in November from October, the third consecutive month of growth, the private National Industry Confederation (CNI) said.
CNI said November's results contradicted the views of some economists that the Brazilian economy was in danger of overheating.
In seasonally adjusted terms, November showed a 0.36 percent drop in the number of people employed in industry and a 1.54 percent fall in the number of hours worked compared with October, CNI said.
Average usage of industrial capacity fell to 78.4 percent in November from 78.5 percent in October.
The seasonally adjusted increase in sales "reflects a clear recovery in the second half (of 1996) which in part can be attributed to easier access for consumers to credit," CNI said.
The 1.45 percent increase in seasonally adjusted sales was the highest monthly increase since the CNI began monitoring output in 1992, it said.
